explanation: formal; feeling very sorry and guilty for something bad that you have done
sentence: She seemed genuinely contrite when she apologized.
sentence_gap: She seemed genuinely ________ when she apologized.

explanation: not giving or having much light; that you cannot remember or imagine clearly
sentence: The lamp gave out a dim light. She had a dim recollection of meeting him.
sentence_gap: The lamp gave out a ___ light. She had a ___ recollection of meeting him.

explanation: to avoid being hit by something by moving quickly to one side
sentence: He dodged to avoid the hurtling bicycle.
sentence_gap: He ______ to avoid the hurtling bicycle.

explanation: a feeling of great pleasure and attraction, especially because something is very beautiful
sentence: The audience looked on in utter fascination and enchantment.
sentence_gap: The audience looked on in utter fascination and ___________.

explanation: a person who takes part in a competition or an exam; a person who becomes a member of a group or organization
sentence: All entrants complete two three-hour papers.

explanation: the leaves of a plant or tree, or leaves on the stems or branches on which they are growing
sentence: The dense foliage overhead almost blocked out the sun.
sentence_gap: The dense _______ overhead almost blocked out the sun.

explanation: (in stories) a small ugly creature that likes to trick people or cause trouble
sentence: I think that that is probably a hobgoblin that we can put behind us for the indefinite future.
sentence_gap: I think that that is probably a _________ that we can put behind us for the indefinite future.

explanation: (of color or sound) soft, rich, and pleasant; (of a taste or flavor) smooth and pleasant; (of people) calm, gentle, and reasonable because of age or experience
sentence: Mellow music and lighting helped to create the right atmosphere.
sentence_gap: ______ music and lighting helped to create the right atmosphere.

explanation: to wake someone up or make someone more active or excited
sentence: The speaker attempted to rouse the crowd with a cry for action.
sentence_gap: The speaker attempted to _____ the crowd with a cry for action.

explanation: (of people) making a lot of noise or likely to cause trouble
sentence: The theater was full of rowdy teenagers throwing popcorn and yelling.
sentence_gap: The theater was full of _____ teenagers throwing popcorn and yelling.

sentence: Wheat, barley and spelt were the leading crops.
sentence_gap: Wheat, barley and _____ were the leading crops.

sentence: One early thrush gave me a note or two as I drove along the woodland path.
sentence_gap: One early ______ gave me a note or two as I drove along the woodland path.

explanation: a small piece of interesting information, or a small dish of pleasant-tasting food
sentence: Our guide gave us some interesting tidbits about the history of the castle.
sentence_gap: Our guide gave us some interesting _______ about the history of the castle.

explanation: (of a person) having ideas that most people think are strange or unpleasant; bent or twisted and not in the normal shape
sentence: In their warped minds I was to blame for my own victimization.
sentence_gap: In their ______ minds I was to blame for my own victimization.

explanation: a continuous low sound, for example the sound made by the regular movement of a machine or the wings of a bird
sentence: There was a whirring of machinery.
